Package civitas.celestis.math.util

Class Numbers

java.lang.Object
civitas.celestis.math.util.Numbers
public final class Numbers extends Object
Contains utility methods related to numbers.

  • Field Details

    • MARGIN_OF_SIGNIFICANCE

      public static final double MARGIN_OF_SIGNIFICANCE
      The margin of significance. Any differences below this value will be considered zero.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

      Explicitly denotes that a given field requires a finite value as its input.
      Parameters:

      Returns:
      The value provided as the input parameter
      Throws:

      Returns a random double between the provided boundaries.
      Parameters:

      max - Maximum acceptable value
      Returns:
      A random value between min and max

    • safeCastToInt

      public static int safeCastToInt(double value)
      Safely casts a double to an int. The resulting value is guaranteed to represent the double as accurately as possible.
      Parameters:
      value - Value to represent as an integer
      Returns:
      The integer representation of the double
      Throws:
      UnsupportedOperationException - When the operation will result in an underflow or an overflow

      Returns:

      denominator - Denominator of the calculation
      Returns:
      The result of the division
      Throws:

    • correct

      public static double correct(double value)
      If the given value is an integer (which is determined by isInteger(double)), this corrects the given value to the nearest integer.
      Parameters:
      value - Value to correct to nearest integer
      Returns:
      Corrected value is the value is an integer, the original value if not

    • isInteger

      public static boolean isInteger(double n)
      Checks if given value n is an integer, while accounting for the MARGIN_OF_SIGNIFICANCE.
      Parameters:
      n - The number to check
      Returns:
      true if the number can be considered an integer

    • compare

      public static int compare(double d1, double d2)
      Compares two doubles while accounting for the MARGIN_OF_SIGNIFICANCE.
      Parameters:
      d1 - The first double to compare
      d2 - The second double to compare
      Returns:
      0 if the two doubles are considered equal, 1 if the first is larger, -1 if the second is larger

    • isParallel

      public static boolean isParallel(@Nonnull Vector2 v1, @Nonnull Vector2 v2)
      Checks if two vectors are facing the same direction. This accounts for small errors using the MARGIN_OF_SIGNIFICANCE.
      Parameters:
      v1 - The first vector to compare
      v2 - The second vector to compare
      Returns:
      true if the dot product of the two vectors are equal to or smaller than the threshold

    • isParallel

      public static boolean isParallel(@Nonnull Vector3 v1, @Nonnull Vector3 v2)
      Checks if two vectors are facing the same direction. This accounts for small errors using the MARGIN_OF_SIGNIFICANCE.
      Parameters:
      v1 - The first vector to compare
      v2 - The second vector to compare
      Returns:
      true if the dot product of the two vectors are equal to or smaller than the threshold

    • isParallel

      public static boolean isParallel(@Nonnull Vector4 v1, @Nonnull Vector4 v2)
      Checks if two vectors are facing the same direction. This accounts for small errors using the MARGIN_OF_SIGNIFICANCE.
      Parameters:
      v1 - The first vector to compare
      v2 - The second vector to compare
      Returns:
      true if the dot product of the two vectors are equal to or smaller than the threshold
